Section.Catchline: Organization of district courts of appeal.

SectionBody.Text: A district court of appeal shall be organized in each of the five appellate districts to be named District Court of Appeal, District. The number of judges of each district court of appeal shall be as follows:

Subsection.Text: In the first district there shall be 15 judges.
In the second district there shall be 14 judges.
In the third district there shall be 10 judges.
In the fourth district there shall be 12 judges.
In the fifth district there shall be 10 judges.
